  17. (* Machine-specific command-line options *)

  19. ‌let command_line_options =
  20.   [ "-fPIC", Arg.Set Clflags.pic_code,
  21.       " Generate position-independent machine code (default)";
  22.     "-fno-PIC", Arg.Clear Clflags.pic_code,
  23.       " Generate position-dependent machine code" ]

  25. (* Specific operations for the AMD64 processor *)

  27. open Format

  29. ‌type addressing_mode =
  30.     Ibased of string * int              (* symbol + displ *)
  31.   | Iindexed of int                     (* reg + displ *)
  32.   | Iindexed2 of int                    (* reg + reg + displ *)
  33.   | Iscaled of int * int                (* reg * scale + displ *)
  34.   | Iindexed2scaled of int * int        (* reg + reg * scale + displ *)

  36. ‌type specific_operation =
  37.     Ilea of addressing_mode             (* "lea" gives scaled adds *)
  38.   | Istore_int of nativeint * addressing_mode * bool
  39.                                         (* Store an integer constant *)
  40.   | Ioffset_loc of int * addressing_mode (* Add a constant to a location *)
  41.   | Ifloatarithmem of float_operation * addressing_mode
  42.                                        (* Float arith operation with memory *)
  43.   | Ibswap of int                      (* endianness conversion *)
  44.   | Isqrtf                             (* Float square root *)
  45.   | Ifloatsqrtf of addressing_mode     (* Float square root from memory *)
  46.   | Isextend32                         (* 32 to 64 bit conversion with sign
  47.                                           extension *)
  48.   | Izextend32                         (* 32 to 64 bit conversion with zero
  49.                                           extension *)

  51. ‌and float_operation =
  52.     Ifloatadd | Ifloatsub | Ifloatmul | Ifloatdiv

  54. (* Sizes, endianness *)

  56. ‌let big_endian = false

  58. ‌let size_addr = 8
  59. ‌let size_int = 8
  60. ‌let size_float = 8

  62. ‌let allow_unaligned_access = true

  64. (* Behavior of division *)

  66. ‌let division_crashes_on_overflow = true

  68. (* Operations on addressing modes *)

  70. ‌let identity_addressing = Iindexed 0

  72. ‌let offset_addressing addr delta =
  73.   match addr with
  74.     Ibased(s, n) -> Ibased(s, n + delta)
  75.   | Iindexed n -> Iindexed(n + delta)
  76.   | Iindexed2 n -> Iindexed2(n + delta)
  77.   | Iscaled(scale, n) -> Iscaled(scale, n + delta)
  78.   | Iindexed2scaled(scale, n) -> Iindexed2scaled(scale, n + delta)

  80. ‌let num_args_addressing = function
  81.     Ibased _ -> 0
  82.   | Iindexed _ -> 1
  83.   | Iindexed2 _ -> 2
  84.   | Iscaled _ -> 1
  85.   | Iindexed2scaled _ -> 2

  87. (* Printing operations and addressing modes *)

  89. ‌let print_addressing printreg addr ppf arg =
  90.   match addr with
  91.   | Ibased(s, 0) ->
  92.       fprintf ppf "\"%s\"" s
  93.   | Ibased(s, n) ->
  94.       fprintf ppf "\"%s\" + %i" s n
  95.   | Iindexed n ->
  96.       let idx = if n <> 0 then Printf.sprintf " + %i" n else "" in
  97.       fprintf ppf "%a%s" printreg arg.(0) idx
  98.   | Iindexed2 n ->
  99. ‌      let idx = if n <> 0 then Printf.sprintf " + %i" n else "" in
  100.       fprintf ppf "%a + %a%s" printreg arg.(0) printreg arg.(1) idx
  101.   | Iscaled(scale, n) ->
  102. ‌      let idx = if n <> 0 then Printf.sprintf " + %i" n else "" in
  103.       fprintf ppf "%a  * %i%s" printreg arg.(0) scale idx
  104.   | Iindexed2scaled(scale, n) ->
  105. ‌      let idx = if n <> 0 then Printf.sprintf " + %i" n else "" in
  106.       fprintf ppf "%a + %a * %i%s" printreg arg.(0) printreg arg.(1) scale idx

  108. ‌let print_specific_operation printreg op ppf arg =
  109.   match op with
  110.   | Ilea addr -> print_addressing printreg addr ppf arg
  111.   | Istore_int(n, addr, is_assign) ->
  112.       fprintf ppf "[%a] := %nd %s"
  113.          (print_addressing printreg addr) arg n
  114.          (if is_assign then "(assign)" else "(init)")
  115.   | Ioffset_loc(n, addr) ->
  116.       fprintf ppf "[%a] +:= %i" (print_addressing printreg addr) arg n
  117.   | Isqrtf ->
  118.       fprintf ppf "sqrtf %a" printreg arg.(0)
  119.   | Ifloatsqrtf addr ->
  120.      fprintf ppf "sqrtf float64[%a]"
  121.              (print_addressing printreg addr) [|arg.(0)|]
  122.   | Ifloatarithmem(op, addr) ->
  123.       let op_name = function
  124.       | Ifloatadd -> "+f"
  125.       | Ifloatsub -> "-f"
  126.       | Ifloatmul -> "*f"
  127.       | Ifloatdiv -> "/f" in
  128.       fprintf ppf "%a %s float64[%a]" printreg arg.(0) (op_name op)
  129.                    (print_addressing printreg addr)
  130.                    (Array.sub arg 1 (Array.length arg - 1))
  131.   | Ibswap i ->
  132.       fprintf ppf "bswap_%i %a" i printreg arg.(0)
  133.   | Isextend32 ->
  134.       fprintf ppf "sextend32 %a" printreg arg.(0)
  135.   | Izextend32 ->
  136.       fprintf ppf "zextend32 %a" printreg arg.(0)

  138. (* Are we using the Windows 64-bit ABI? *)

  140. ‌let win64 =
  141.   match Config.system with
  142.   | "win64" | "mingw64" | "cygwin" -> true
  143.   | _                   -> false

  145. (* Specific operations that are pure *)

  147. ‌let operation_is_pure = function
  148.   | Ilea _ | Ibswap _ | Isqrtf | Isextend32 | Izextend32 -> true
  149.   | Ifloatarithmem _ | Ifloatsqrtf _ -> true
  150.   | _ -> false

  152. (* Specific operations that can raise *)

  154. ‌let operation_can_raise _ = false

  156. open X86_ast

  158. (* Certain float conditions aren't represented directly in the opcode for
  159.    float comparison, so we have to swap the arguments. The swap information
  160.    is also needed downstream because one of the arguments is clobbered. *)
  161. ‌let float_cond_and_need_swap cond =
  162.   match (cond : Lambda.float_comparison) with
  163.   | CFeq  -> EQf,  false
  164.   | CFneq -> NEQf, false
  165.   | CFlt  -> LTf,  false
  166.   | CFnlt -> NLTf, false
  167.   | CFgt  -> LTf,  true
  168.   | CFngt -> NLTf, true
  169.   | CFle  -> LEf,  false
  170.   | CFnle -> NLEf, false
  171.   | CFge  -> LEf,  true
  172.   | CFnge -> NLEf, true
